GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2013 as The Mind Lab to address the imbalance between what children were learning at school and the skills that the future would require of them. Tech Futures Lab was created in 2016 to support professionals and businesses in developing the critical skills needed to excel in the ‘future of work.’ In late 2022, Earth Futures Lab joined the portfolio of future-focused faculties to place focus on building knowledge, skills and capabilities in sustainability practices and technologies that can support sustainable outcomes for people and the environment. In January 2023 a new over-arching entity brought together the three postgraduate faculties of The Mind Lab, Tech Futures Lab and Earth Futures Lab - under the umbrella of academyEX - the academy excellence
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: All year (intakes begin 2-3 times a year)
AdmissionRequirements: Vary by programme, but two admission pathways: 1
Level 8 qualification or higher (or equivalent if not a New Zealand qualification); 2
Equivalent professional experience (evidenced to be provided and assessed)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1990 as Auckland Institute of Studies (AIS). Branded as AIS St Helens upon acquiring the St Helens campus in 1993. Rebranded as Auckland Institute of Studies (AIS) in 2014

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1895 as Auckland Technical School. Renamed Auckland Technical College 1906 and Seddon Memorial Technical College 1913. Separated into two institutions - a technical high school and a technical institute 1960 which was renamed Auckland Technical Institute (ATI) 1963. Became Auckland Institute of Technology (Te Whare Takiura o Tamaki Makau Rau) 1989. Acquired present status and title 2000

Address.college_name: Medical Research Institute of New Zealand
Address.university_name: Medical Research Institute of New Zealand-Rangahautia Te Ora (MRINZ)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2001 as an independent medical research organisation. Since this time it has become internationally recognised as one of New Zealand's major medical research organisations publishing innovative research in high impact international journals. The MRINZ enjoys strong collaborations within New Zealand and internationally. Its mission is to investigate the causes of important public health problems, to use this knowledge to improve the prevention and treatment of diseases, and to provide a base for specialist training in medical research. Their particular focus is on research which has the potential to lead to improvements in clinical management
AdmissionRequirements: MBChB or equivalent; fluent spoken and written English
